newsitem.title: USA: Quintiles Transnational Corp to buy CVA.
newsitem.headline: Quintiles Transnational Corp to buy CVA.

text.p: Quintiles Transnational Corp said on Thursday it signed a definitive agreement to acquire CerebroVascular Advances Inc, a clinical research company, for about 251,000 shares of Quintiles stock.
The agreement will be recorded as a pooling of interests, Quintiles said in a statement.
Completion of the acquisition, which is subject to CVA shareholder approval, is expected later this year, Quintiles said.
The transaction is expected to be neutral or slightly accretive to Quintiles' 1997 earnings per share, it added.
CVA, based in San Antonio, Texas, recorded net revenue of $4.5 million and net income of $1.3 million in 1996, Quintiles said.
The company also said that it plans to enter into employment agreements with several members of CVA's management staff, including its president and chief executive David Edwards.
It said a CVA strength was its research into stroke-related drugs.

"With aging populations in many regions of the world, we believe more resources will be devoted to develop drugs to prevent or counteract the debilitating effects of stroke," said Quintiles chief executive Dennis Gillings.
"CVA has an outstanding record of clinical development in this area," he added.
Quintiles Transnational Corp provides contract research, sales and marketing services to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device industries.
